text: HBO Max’s new TV and movie release schedule for July 7 to July 13, 2025, includes 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After? Season 9, Wardens of the North Season 4, Celebrity IOU Season 10, and Rage (Furia.) On July 7, 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After? Season 9 drops on HBO Max. The reality show catches up with the most popular couples from the 90 Day Fiancé series. It showcases the pair struggling to get along and build a stable and healthy relationship. Further, Wardens of the North Season 4 will be available on the streaming platform. The series follows the lives of the men and women staying in the wilderness of Michigan. However, they wish to make the place safer for humans and animals at the same time. Also coming to the platform this week is Celebrity IOU Season 10. It focuses on the popular brothers and home renovation brothers, Jonathan and Drew Scott, lending a helping hand to the A-listers of Hollywood. They help the celebrities surprise their loved ones with the best home renovations. Additionally, the drama series Rage (Furia) premieres on HBO Max. Created by Felix Sabroso, it traces the lives of five different women. These ladies end up facing extreme situations involving oppression, extortion, and manipulation, leading to unpredictable influence in the future. New HBO Max releases for July 7-July 13, 2025 Below are all the new TV shows and movies being added to HBO Max from July 7 to July 13, 2025. Monday, July 7 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After?, Season 9 (TLC) Wardens of the North, Season 4 (Animal Planet) Thursday, July 10 Back to the Frontier, Season 1 (Max Original, Magnolia Network) Celebrity IOU, Season 10 (HGTV) Isadora Moon, Season 1B (Max Original) Friday, July 11 Chasing the West, Season 1 (HGTV) House Hunters International: Volume 9, Season 202 (HGTV) House Hunters: Volume 10, Season 243 (HGTV) Opus (A24) Rage (Furia), Season 1 (HBO Original) Saturday, July 12 Gold Rush: Mine Rescue with Freddy & Juan, Season 5 (Discovery) For more HBO Max content, check out the latest update on The Last of Us Season 3.
html:
HBO Max’s new TV and movie release schedule for July 7 to July 13, 2025, includes 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After? Season 9, Wardens of the North Season 4, Celebrity IOU Season 10, and Rage (Furia.)

On July 7, 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After? Season 9 drops on HBO Max. The reality show catches up with the most popular couples from the 90 Day Fiancé series. It showcases the pair struggling to get along and build a stable and healthy relationship.

Further, Wardens of the North Season 4 will be available on the streaming platform. The series follows the lives of the men and women staying in the wilderness of Michigan. However, they wish to make the place safer for humans and animals at the same time.

Also coming to the platform this week is Celebrity IOU Season 10. It focuses on the popular brothers and home renovation brothers, Jonathan and Drew Scott, lending a helping hand to the A-listers of Hollywood. They help the celebrities surprise their loved ones with the best home renovations.

Additionally, the drama series Rage (Furia) premieres on HBO Max. Created by Felix Sabroso, it traces the lives of five different women. These ladies end up facing extreme situations involving oppression, extortion, and manipulation, leading to unpredictable influence in the future.

New HBO Max releases for July 7-July 13, 2025

Below are all the new TV shows and movies being added to HBO Max from July 7 to July 13, 2025.

Monday, July 7

  • 90 Day Fiancé: Happily Ever After?, Season 9 (TLC)
  • Wardens of the North, Season 4 (Animal Planet)

Thursday, July 10

  • Back to the Frontier, Season 1 (Max Original, Magnolia Network)
  • Celebrity IOU, Season 10 (HGTV)
  • Isadora Moon, Season 1B (Max Original)

Friday, July 11

  • Chasing the West, Season 1 (HGTV)
  • House Hunters International: Volume 9, Season 202 (HGTV)
  • House Hunters: Volume 10, Season 243 (HGTV)
  • Opus (A24)
  • Rage (Furia), Season 1 (HBO Original)

Saturday, July 12

  • Gold Rush: Mine Rescue with Freddy & Juan, Season 5 (Discovery)

For more HBO Max content, check out the latest update on The Last of Us Season 3.
